title: Science of skincare: what are alpha hydroxy acids and what are the beauty benefits?
text:
You might not have heard of alpha hydroxy acids (AHAs), but there’s a very high chance that lactic or glycolic acid is on the packaging of some of your favourite cleansers, exfoliators and serums. AHA’s are popular ingredients with skincare brands and dermatologists, however as with all acids, they do need to be used carefully. As part of our Science of skincare series, we’ve teamed up with cosmetic dermatologist Dr Sam Bunting, who talks through the pro’s and con’s of AHA’s in the video above.

What are alpha hydroxy acids?

Alpha hydroxy acids, or AHAs are fruit acids and the most common examples are lactic and glycolic acids, which can both be manufactured or found naturally. The former is found in milk and the latter can be sourced from sugar cane, as Dr Bunting explains in the video.
